snippet: Google may have had a challenging first three months of the year from a public relations standpoint, with government officials and ordinary users alike troubled by the company's new privacy policy, David Streitfeld writes in The New York Times on...
abstract: Google may have had a challenging first three months of the year from a public relations standpoint, with government officials and ordinary users alike troubled by the company's new privacy policy, David Streitfeld writes in The New York Times on Friday. But its financial results, reported on Thursday, were another matter, as the company largely rebounded from a weaker previous quarter.

headline.main: Daily Report: Google Announces 2-for-1 Stock Split
